title: Synonym Detection
description: Use this job to generate synonym and similar query pairs.

id.title: Spark Job ID
id.description: The ID for this Spark job. Used in the API to reference this job. Allowed characters: a-z, A-Z, dash (-) and underscore (_). Maximum length: 63 characters.

trainingCollection.title: Input Collection
trainingCollection.description: Collection containing queries, document id and event counts. Can be either signal aggregation collection or raw signals collection.

fieldToVectorize.title: Query Field Name
fieldToVectorize.description: Field containing queries. Change to query to use against raw signals

dataFormat.title: Data format
dataFormat.description: Spark-compatible format that contains training data (like 'solr', 'parquet', 'orc' etc)

trainingDataFrameConfigOptions.title: Dataframe Config Options
trainingDataFrameConfigOptions.description: Additional spark dataframe loading configuration options

trainingDataFilterQuery.title: Data filter query
trainingDataFilterQuery.description: Solr query to use when loading training data if using Solr, Spark SQL expression for all other data sources

sparkSQL.title: Spark SQL filter query
sparkSQL.description: Use this field to create a Spark SQL query for filtering your input data. The input data will be registered as spark_input

trainingDataSamplingFraction.title: Training data sampling fraction
trainingDataSamplingFraction.description: Fraction of the training data to use

randomSeed.title: Random seed
randomSeed.description: For any deterministic pseudorandom number generation

outputCollection.title: Output Collection
outputCollection.description: Collection to store synonym and similar query pairs.

sourceFields.title: Fields to Load
sourceFields.description: Solr fields to load (comma-delimited). Leave empty to allow the job to select the required fields to load at runtime.

partitionCols.title: Partition fields
partitionCols.description: If writing to non-Solr sources, this field will accept a comma-delimited list of column names for partitioning the dataframe before writing to the external output

writeOptions.title: Write Options
writeOptions.description: Options used when writing output to Solr or other sources

readOptions.title: Read Options
readOptions.description: Options used when reading input from Solr or other sources.

misspellingCollection.title: Misspelling Job Result Collection
misspellingCollection.description: Solr collection containing reviewed result of Token and phrase spell correction job. Defaults to the query_rewrite_staging collection for the app.

misspellingsFilterQuery.title: Misspelling Job Result Filter Query
misspellingsFilterQuery.description: Solr query to additionally filter the misspelling results. Defaults to reading all approved spell corrections.

keyPhraseCollection.title: Phrase Extraction Job Result Collection
keyPhraseCollection.description: Solr collection containing reviewed result of Phrase extraction job. Defaults to the query_rewrite_staging collection for the app.

keyPhraseFilterQuery.title: Phrase Extraction Job Result Filter Query
keyPhraseFilterQuery.description: Solr query to additionally filter the phrase extraction results. Defaults to reading all approved phrases.

misspellingSQL.title: Spark SQL filter query for misspelling data
misspellingSQL.description: Use this field to create a Spark SQL query for filtering your input data. The input data will be registered as spell_input
misspellingSQL.default: SELECT surface_form AS misspelling_s, output AS correction_s FROM spell_input WHERE doc_type  = 'query_rewrite' AND type = 'spell' AND review IN ('approved' OR 'auto')

misspellingSQLDataFormat.title: Misspelling Data format
misspellingSQLDataFormat.description: Spark-compatible format that contains spelling data (like 'solr', 'parquet', 'orc' etc)

phraseSQL.title: Spark SQL filter query for phrase data
phraseSQL.description: Use this field to create a Spark SQL query for filtering your input data. The input data will be registered as phrase_input
phraseSQL.default: SELECT surface_form AS phrases_s, coalesce(confidence, lit(1d)) AS likelihood_d, coalesce(word_count, lit(1d)) AS word_num_i FROM phrase_input WHERE doc_type  = 'query_rewrite' AND type = 'phrase' AND review IN ('approved' OR 'auto')

phraseSQLDataFormat.title: Phrase Data format
phraseSQLDataFormat.description: Spark-compatible format that contains phrase data (like 'solr', 'parquet', 'orc' etc)

countField.title: Event Count Field Name
countField.description: Solr field containing number of events (e.g., number of clicks). Change to count_i when running against raw signals

docIdField.title: Document id Field Name
docIdField.description: Solr field containing document id that user clicked. Change to doc_id for raw signal collection

overlapThreshold.title: Query Similarity Threshold
overlapThreshold.description: The threshold above which query pairs are consider similar. We can get more synonym pairs if increase this value but quality may get reduced.

similarityThreshold.title: Synonym Similarity Threshold
similarityThreshold.description: The threshold above which synonym pairs are consider similar. We can get more synonym pairs if increase this value but quality may get reduced.

minQueryCount.title: Query Clicks Threshold
minQueryCount.description: The min number of clicked documents needed for comparing queries.

keywordsBlobName.title: Keywords Blob Store
keywordsBlobName.description: Name of the keywords blob resource. Typically, this should be a csv file uploaded to blob store in a specific format. Check documentation for more details on format and uploading to blob store.

synonymBlobName.title: Custom Synonym Blob Store
synonymBlobName.description: Name of the custom synonym blob resource. This is a Solr synonym file that will be used in the synonym detection job and will override any generated synonyms (indicated by a 'supplied' field in the Rules UI).

stopwordsList.title: List of stopwords
stopwordsList.description: Stopwords defined in Lucene analyzer config

enableAutoPublish.title: Enable auto-publishing
enableAutoPublish.description: If true, automatically publishes rewrites for rules. Default is false to allow for initial human-aided reviewing

sparkPartitions.title: Set minimum Spark partitions for input
sparkPartitions.description: Spark will re-partition the input to have this number of partitions. Increase for greater parallelism
